div.l: For cokkis soule / and heer a nobil game
For bi that lord / that called is seynt Iame
As I haue thries / in this shorte nyhte
Swyved the milleris dohtir bolt vpriht
Whiles thow hast / as coward ben a gast
Ye false harlot / qduod the millere hast
A false clerk / false treytour / qduod he
Thou shalt be ded / bi goddis dygnyte
Who durste be so bolde / to disparage
My douhter / that is come of such lygnage
And bi the throte bolle / he cauht Alayn
And he hym hente / dispitously agayn
And on the nose he smot hym with his fest
Doıı̄un ran the bloody strem / vpon his brest
And in the floor / with nose ⁊and mouthe to broke
They walwed as too pigges in a poke
And vp they gon and doıı̄un ageyn A noon
Til that the miller / spurned at a stoon
And doıı̄un he fil bakward / on his wyf
That wiste no thyng / of this nyce stryf
For she was falle a sleep / a litel wyht
With Iohn the clerk / that waked al the nyht
And with that fal / out of hir slepe she brayde
Help holy cros of bromholm she sayde
In manꝰus tuas / lord to the I calle
A wake symond / the fend is on me falle
Myn herte is brokyn / help I nam but ded
Ther lyht oon vp myn wombe ⁊and vp myn hede
Help symkyn / for the fals clerkis fyhte
This Iohn stirt vp / as fast as euyr he myhte
And grasped bi the walles / too and fro
To fynde a staff / and she stirt vp also
And knew thestis / bet than did this Iohn
And bi the wal / a staf she fond a noon
And sauh a litel shymeryng of the light
For at an hole / in shon the moone liht brihtlihtbriht
And bi that liht / she sawh hem bothe too
But sikirli she nyste / who was who
